data.title: Home :: Kettle Creek Music Festival
data.text:
RIZE

RIZE is a Classic Rock band from Central Pa. known for playing some of the best "Arena Rock" songs from the 70's and 80's. If you like Styx, Journey, Kansas, Foreigner, REO Speedwagon and other Stadium Tour bands of the time, make sure you catch a RIZE show near you. These 5 accomplished musicians honed their skills playing in several of the areas top bands over the years and joined forces in 2016 to bring you songs seldom heard by your average bands. RIZE is: Kevin VanAmburg - Guitar, Vocals and Keyboards Rusty Bottorf - Drums and Vocals Paul Chapman - Keyboards and Vocals Steve Hauser - Bass and Backing Vocals Jim Watson - Guitar

6:30-8:30 PM

Second Time Thru

Second Time Thru is an "All Age" `60s, `70s & `80s band that performs throughout Central PA. With over 200 venue performances and music from over 60 artists in our repertoire, the band is a pretty well-oiled music machine. Centered on rich, four part harmonies and musical synergy where the total exceeds the sum of the parts. Second Time Thru provides an entertaining experience that will bring back some your fondest musical memories.

4:00 - 6:00 PM

Katz 22

Katz 22 is a four-piece powerhouse rock & roll dance band with excellent musicianship and superb vocalists. Featuring drummer John Hawl, bassist Rusty Fohner, keyboardist Zach Nyce and guitarist Kathy Rimm, Katz 22 entertains like no other band in PA. The band has one goal in mind when they hit the stage - get people out of their seats and onto the dance floor. Their music is the best rock & roll ever made and the band has achieved their goal, night after night, filling dance floors all over PA and beyond.

9:00-11:00 PM

Make Mine Country Band

The Make Mine Country Band is comprised of five of central Pennsylvania's most versatile and accomplished musicians drawing their experience from vintage country crying steel guitar laden ballads, old upbeat rock and roll hits, some toe tapping bluegrass songs, and even some classic blues, heavy metal and punk tunes! When together onstage, they get back to their roots and let that good old country music resonate from their instruments and voices during their shows.

11:00 - 1:00 PM

Lone Crow Rebellion

Lone Crow Rebellion is a blues rock quartet that excels at rocking the blues and classic grooves. Hailing for western Pennsylvania, the rust belt and post industrial region provides muse to the bands proven style and modern approach to blues rock music. Elements of blues, gospel, southern rock, americana & good ole' rock & roll can be heard in their music. The band formed in 2018 , wrote and recorded their first collection of tunes found on the album " Ain't No Shame". More new singles have been released and a second album, "Coal Train Blues" is on the way. The band evolved into the current line up of Greg Long on lead vocals and guitar, Pete Horm on bass, John Samanka on keyboards and harmonica, and Jason Sopic on drums. The music they produce is timeless, as well as very much up to date. Excellent listening no matter what the situation.

6:30 - 8:30 PM

West of the Mark (7 piece band)

West of the Mark is a 4-piece band based out of Buffalo, NY. They were established in 2004 and continue to be the most in-demand country band throughout the area. To date the band has performed nearly 1500 shows and in 2022 alone, they will top out at 113 performances! This year has included an unprecedented residency at a new venue in Buffalo called The Stage. From October of 2021 through today, they have performed every Thursday night for “country night” sponsored by the ACM award winning radio station WYRK 106.5FM. It continues to be the biggest “country night” in the region.

9:00 - 11:00 PM
